title: New Mexico State Income Tax Calculator

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Tax formulas in LaTeX format For taxable income x and bracket cutoffs c_0 = 0 < c_1 < ... < c_n with rates r_1, ..., r_n: (1) T(x) = \sum_{i=1}^{n} r_i \cdot \max\!\bigl(0,\; \min(x, c_i) - c_{i-1} \bigr) Marginal rate m(x) is the r_k for the bracket where c_{k-1} < x \le c_k. If estimating from gross pay G with pre-tax deductions P and deduction D (standard or itemized): (2) \text{TaxableIncome} = \max(0,\; G - P - D) Effective rate: (3) \text{EffectiveRate} = \frac{T(x)}{x} \quad \text{for } x > 0

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: For taxable income x and bracket cutoffs c_0 = 0 < c_1 < ... < c_n with rates r_1, ..., r_n: (1) T(x) = \sum_{i=1}^{n} r_i \cdot \max\!\bigl(0,\; \min(x, c_i) - c_{i-1} \bigr) Marginal rate m(x) is the r_k for the bracket where c_{k-1} < x \le c_k. If estimating from gross pay G with pre-tax deductions P and deduction D (standard or itemized): (2) \text{TaxableIncome} = \max(0,\; G - P - D) Effective rate: (3) \text{EffectiveRate} = \frac{T(x)}{x} \quad \text{for } x > 0

variables.meaning: property tax (annual or monthly depending on input)
